Webrip defines an album that is ripped for an online source, as as MTV. You know how MTV or another music site sometimes stream an album before its released? Well people will record that stream and then package the songs and call it a webrip.

Additionally, can we get a perma ban on Elaine9? Fuck your stupid sites! Sure they CLAIM your credit card is only for verification, as well as social security number to watch...

Also funny how the download link goes to silenthill3d.mp4.exe

IF you liked the first movie and are a fan of the games, this movie is just fine. It really was not bad for fans, but I can understand why people who haven't immersed themselves in the Silent Hill world wouldn't like it. Just keep in mind, most scary movies are critically panned, and this movie needs to be judged off what it provided for SH fans, and not the average movie goer.

woyaboy is correct.  If you played the games I think you'll enjoy seeing Pyramid Head, and Alessa, and that detective dude come to life.  It's pretty cool.

The first one was way better! The plot for this is also off. In the first one, the dark part of Alessa killed off all the townspeople. But now some somehow managed to survive, even though in the first one ALL of them were in the church...hmmm, WTF?
What is that thing that pops up at 1:15:19? Looks like a command prompt but I can't really tell.
Why is it listed as being 89 minutes? The other copies are 94 minutes. ఠ_ಠ

@linnie.wesker, I can’t afford the bandwidth to download it just to check (I’m going to get one of the other copies), but I am guessing that the ripper (ViP3R) used a screen-capture tool to copy the contents of their screen, and at some point it, or something else, popped up a window.

Of course this means that this rip is just a re-encode of the web stream instead of the web stream itself. It would have been better to either download the video, or use an RTSP-capture program (and then a video-conversion program like VDub or AviDemux) to get it. By just capturing the decompressed frames as they are shown on screen, it is susceptible to frame-dropping, not to mention re-compression.
